newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary Jan-Aug C/A deficit $1.066 bln.
newsitem.headline: Hungary Jan-Aug C/A deficit $1.066 bln.

text.p: Hungary's accumulated current account deficit fell to $1.066 billion in the January-August period of 1996 from $2.284 billion in the same eight months of 1995, the National Bank of Hungary (NBH) said on Tuesday.
Hungary's accumulated trade deficit shrank to $1.762 billion in January-August 1996 from $1.934 billion in the same period of 1995, the NBH said in its monthly report.
The central bank's reserves amounted to $9.7 billion at the end of August, up from $9.4 billion at the end of July, it said.
Hungary's net foreign debt declined to $13.8 billion at the end of August from $14.4 billion at the end of July, the NBH said.
